emails.subject: Confidential: CTO track role — 15 min today?
emails.preview: We’re building a platform team and your profile matches the exact leadership shape we need.
body: I’m reaching out discreetly. A Series C company (Nordics-based, global customers) is forming a new Platform/Infra org and wants someone who can set standards, hire, and ship.
The CEO asked me to connect directly after seeing your work. If you’re open to a quick call today or tomorrow, I’ll share the compensation band and the context behind the mandate.

emails.subject: Quick question — would you consider leading engineering?
emails.preview: We’re a small team shipping fast. I’d like to talk about a VP Eng mandate with real ownership.
body: I’ll keep this short. I’m the CEO at Arcfield Systems. We’re at the point where execution needs a dedicated engineering leader who can scale the team while keeping product velocity.
If you have 20 minutes this week, I’d love to share what we’re building and hear what you’d want from a role like this.

emails.subject: Senior Frontend Lead — design systems + performance focus
emails.preview: You’d own the web platform experience end‑to‑end. Hybrid in Stockholm, flexible.
body: I’m working with a product company that’s rebuilding their design system and web platform. They need a senior lead who’s pragmatic about UX and fast about delivery.
Would you be open to a quick intro? If now isn’t ideal, I can circle back later this quarter.

emails.subject: Your background popped up — can I pitch you something unusual?
emails.preview: We’re hiring one senior person to unstick a few gnarly platform problems. Not a big team, high trust.
body: I’m CTO at HelioWorks. We’re not doing a huge hiring wave — we want one senior builder who can own some “hard but satisfying” platform work.
If you’re not looking, no worries. If you are, I can share a one‑pager and the comp structure.

emails.subject: Board-intro + advisory track (part-time)
emails.preview: A founder is assembling an advisory board and specifically asked for someone with your product/engineering mix.
body: I’m running an advisory search for a founder building a B2B platform in the EU market. The ask is part-time, flexible, and focused on product/engineering strategy.
If this is interesting, I can share the brief and the expected time commitment.

emails.subject: Offer: onsite workshop + paid technical assessment
emails.preview: We’re trialing a new hiring format that respects senior candidates’ time (and pays for it).
body: We’re experimenting with a hiring process that starts with a paid workshop instead of homework. The company is serious about seniority and wants to meet candidates in real collaboration.
If you want details, I can share the structure and what’s compensated.

emails.subject: Relocation package included — principal engineer role
emails.preview: If Stockholm isn’t a constraint, there’s a principal IC role with unusually strong autonomy.
body: One role that might be relevant: principal engineer (IC) with high autonomy and a relocation package. The team is small but strong, and the scope is broad.
If you’d like, I’ll send the comp band and the tech stack details.

emails.subject: Not a job pitch (yet) — curious about your preferences
emails.preview: I’m mapping roles for the year and want to learn what “good” looks like to you.
body: I’m not pitching a role today. I’m trying to understand what strong engineers/leads actually want right now — comp, autonomy, remote, scope, whatever matters.
If you have 10 minutes, I’d appreciate the perspective.

replyTemplates.label: Polite + closed
replyTemplates.text:
Thank you for reaching out — I appreciate the note. I’m currently not exploring new opportunities, but I’ll keep your details on file. If my situation changes later in the year, I’ll reconnect.

Best regards,

replyTemplates.label: Open later this quarter
replyTemplates.text:
Thanks for the message. I’m heads-down right now and not scheduling new conversations, but I can revisit in a few months. If you send the role summary + comp band, I’ll take a quick look when I resurface.

Regards,

replyTemplates.label: Comp push (professional)
replyTemplates.text:
Thanks — the scope sounds interesting. Based on what you described, I’d only consider it if the compensation reflects the seniority and opportunity cost. If you can share the base range, equity structure, and signing bonus expectations, I’ll respond with a clear yes/no.

Best,

replyTemplates.label: Workshop / paid process
replyTemplates.text:
Appreciate the outreach. I’m willing to engage when the process is time-respectful. If the company supports a paid workshop or structured paid evaluation, I’m open to a first conversation.

Best regards,

replyTemplates.label: Redirect to written brief
replyTemplates.text:
Thanks for contacting me. The fastest way for me to evaluate is a written brief: role mandate, team size, reporting line, stack, and compensation band. If you send that, I’ll reply with next steps.

Regards,

delete: Fast call. Less noise, more signal.
